patches.reasoning: Identified common misconceptions about the end of Roman Britain to address in the lesson.

value.misconception: The Romans left Britain because they were defeated by local tribes
value.description: The Romans left due to internal issues within the Roman Empire itself, not because of a defeat by local tribes. Highlight the economic and political struggles Rome faced.

value.misconception: There were no Romans left in Britain after their departure
value.description: While the Roman army and officials left, many Romans who settled remained. Clarify that Roman influence continued in local culture and infrastructure.
